TWO SCENES FROM SOWING AND REAPING, A YUAN-DYNASTY (CIRCA 1350) COPY OF A SONG-DYNASTY (CIRCA 1150) ILLUSTRATED SCROLL ABOUT THE PRACTICE OF RICE CULTIVATION IN CHINA.

Image 1:

Purchase, W. M. Keck Foundation Gift and other gifts, in memory of Douglas Dillon, 2005

Workers irrigating a rice field by powering a mechanical water wheel with their feet

Image 2:

Purchase, W. M. Keck Foundation Gift and other gifts, in memory of Douglas Dillon, 2005

Men, women, and children harvesting rice
content.question: Which of the following most likely explains why the scroll was copied for a new audience in the 1350s?

choices.label: The Mongol conquests caused widespread destruction to China's irrigation system.
The artist wanted to demonstrate the superiority of the Song dynasty over the Yuan dynasty.
Mongols adopted and spread technological innovations from regions within their empire.
Chinese culture had a significant influence on neighboring countries, such as Korea and Vietnam.

content.answer: Mongols adopted and spread technological innovations from regions within their empire.
